TopicTitle: Kickstarter: The Apollo 11 Virtual Reality Experience - Education VR

Articles.Content:
I figured there ought to be plenty of fans of both VR and space travel history on these forums... ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

If you have an Oculus Rift DK2, you absolutely must check this out. There is a free downloadable demo available, supported on Windows, Mac, and Linux.

This is an educational recreation of the Apollo 11 mission in virtual reality. They've used archived footage and audio, and built detailed models of the command and lunar modules for you to ride in. The demo is the first few minutes of the mission, plus some extra stuff to lead you into it, including part of JFK's 1961 speech asking Congress to initiate the Apollo project.

[https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1436197736/the-apollo-11-virtual-reality-experience-education?wecandoit](https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1436197736/the-apollo-11-virtual-reality-experience-education?wecandoit)
If I had a credit card, I would DEFINITELY support this! I absolutely hope that this succeeds in its development!
it is a fantastic project, but not exist a version without Oculus Rift? also if will be unique try it this experience with the VR.
